verses.kjv: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
verses.ct: I called out to God with my voice — to God with my voice — and he listened to me.

verses.kjv: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.
verses.ct: During my time of trouble I searched for the Lord. All night long my hands were stretched out without stopping; my soul refused to be comforted.

verses.kjv: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
verses.ct: I thought about God and groaned; I meditated, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

verses.kjv: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
verses.ct: You kept my eyes from closing; I was so distressed that I couldn't even speak.

verses.kjv: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
verses.ct: I thought back to earlier days, to the years long past.

verses.kjv: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
verses.ct: I recalled the songs I used to sing at night; I searched my own heart, and my spirit questioned deeply.

verses.kjv: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
verses.ct: Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he never show us his favor again?

verses.kjv: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?
verses.ct: Has his mercy disappeared completely? Has his promise come to an end for all time?

verses.kjv: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
verses.ct: Has God forgotten how to be gracious? Has his anger caused him to hold back his compassion? Selah.

verses.kjv: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.
verses.ct: Then I said, "This is what grieves me — but I will remember the years when the Most High displayed his power."

verses.kjv: I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.
verses.ct: I will remember what the LORD has done; yes, I will remember your amazing acts from long ago.

verses.kjv: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
verses.ct: I will reflect on everything you have done and think deeply about your mighty acts.

verses.kjv: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?
verses.ct: Your way, God, is holy. What god is as great as our God?

verses.kjv: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
verses.ct: You are the God who performs amazing things; you have displayed your strength among the nations.

verses.kjv: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
verses.ct: With your mighty arm you rescued your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

verses.kjv: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.
verses.ct: The waters saw you, God — the waters saw you and churned in terror; even the deepest ocean depths trembled.

verses.kjv: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.
verses.ct: The clouds poured down rain, the heavens rumbled with thunder, and your arrows of lightning flashed in every direction.

verses.kjv: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
verses.ct: Your thunder roared through the heaven; lightning lit up the whole world; the earth shook and quaked.

verses.kjv: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
verses.ct: Your path went through the sea, your road through the mighty waters, yet no one could trace your footsteps.

verses.kjv: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.ct: You guided your people like a flock through the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
